content:
Posted: July 8, 2015
												As much as I love the retro graphics, I can't say I like this game one bit. The controls are horrible and don't think you can use just any old xbox controller because you can't; the developer said a while back that there would be added controler support "eventually" and that has never happened and it's been about a year since then. When creating your character your abilities are completely random and even if you wanted to change them they would randomly generate two completely different spells. Let's say you have "extra health" and "extra magic power," if you click the <change> button you get something like "open golden chests" and "extended pickaxe durability," you don't even have a choice on the abilities you want. When you are crafting different items you have absolutely no idea what there is to craft and if you even have the required materials.Each time you start a new game, you get a tool and like 2 or 3 other randomly generated items in your inventory which you have no idea if they are even useful to you at the moment. It's a roguelike game with lack of exploration and has permanent death*, (which all roguelikes have) not to mention the very low health you get at the start. If this game was less than 2 dollars I would have bought it but lucky for me I didn't have to pay a single cent for it. I traded in my gems from the 2014 Steam sale and got this for free. I wouldn't advise buying this game at its current price.

number of helpful: 11 of 23 people (48%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: January 13, 2016
												Here we are in 2016, and we still have games without tutorials.This game is a highly repetetive grind fest with a cumbersome, unintuitive UI (crafting, inventory, item use; all are as bad as it gets).Roguelikes have replay value and a fresh experience each playthrough; Magicite is nigh identical every time you play, without interesting random generation.Other things are a messTaking damage causes awkward things to happen: you recieve knockback and i-frames; while in i-frames you can still put out an attack animation, but it won't do any damage. Your attacks are very laggy, so getting hit while attacking means waiting for seconds before you can actually attack. Enemies also get i-frames, but they have contact damage during said i-frames. Enemies have attack animations, but always do contact damage even from behind. Enemies get knocked back by your character, but the knockback is ambiguous.Jumps and aerial movement don't have tight controls, and the character moves with the gusto of a cement mixer.

												Magicite is decent game to play with friends.Bought it a long time ago and playd few runs today and somehow it seemed they had messed up rangers wolf ability quite a bit. Game requires quite a bit of skill and fast reflexes to play. It's a shame that most rare loot comes from the golden chests so when playing single player it's a very good choise to pick up lockpick trait.I like the chance to trait system, when you can now pick the traits you want and you don't have to spend ton of time rerolling for the desired result. I think they should same kind system for the stats, because basically if you want to play to ranger you get dex and hp, mag and hp for wizard and att and hp for warrior. Having a pool of 18 choises for stats is also too small to make it more 'random' when choosing stats for your character. Altought random is a good theme in roguelike games when it is not applied to everything.

												Magicite is an epic combination of terraria and spelunky.you start off as a peon and 2 randomly generated skills wich can be rerolled until you have the 2 you want. the game is really hard and takes a few tries before you finnally know how to handle the creatures and how to craft your items but once you know this the game will become really fun. and it will be even better with friends combining different skills and different play styles. throughout the game you will unlock different classes and hats each with their own (dis)advantage to make the game more interesting.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 3, 2016
												This game is probably one of the most fun games I have ever touched.In general, you start out with 1 race, and a set of skills. You spawn in a forest where you have to get resources to survive and not die. Later on you unlock more races, hats, variants and things as such that give you stat boosts or special perks.The worlds themselves are breathtaking. Along with the music, the graphics are amazing, the sprites of the enemies are wonderful, and the feel of the area gets you really amped and happy to play the game.There is difficulty to this game, as not only are the enemies hard but there is also permadeath. Permadeath would pretty much be the only thing I don't like about the game, but thats more of an opinion, as permadeath in a game is not wrong its just some people like it and some don't. But having permadeath actually makes you want to play the game more and more to get further than where you were before.If I were to compare this game, I'd say it would be very close to something like terraria, but I don't usually like comparing games. Why? Because games like this are unique. This game is its own thing, nothing like I have ever played before. It showed me a whole new type of platformer and I am just so happy this game fell into my steam library.So, would I recommend this game? Certainly. Definitely worth the price!P.S. if you ever meet percyl in the forest he will destroy you

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 4, 2016
												I tend to rate things on a Price-Enjoment scale. In terms of Magicite I have played a relatively enjoyable 30ish hours for the addmission price of $10. With a simple calculation that leaves the price 33 cents/hour, a more than far price for this game in my opinion.unfortunatly, this comes with a few disclaimers:1. The game is ment to be played A LOT and it is very brutal. Expect multiple runs meeting requirments only to lose a dice roll for your hard earned reward.2. Muliplayer isn't a garenteed thing. If the game doesn't have built in multiplayer it doesn't have multiplayer in my eyes. Magicite does have built in muliplayer but it is incredably buggy to the point where monsters are almost always in different places between users and resources flicker on and off. (occasionally one player will even continuously fall through the map untill a game restart). All this given I cannot say that Magicite is an out of the box multiplayer expirence worth anything.3. Combat. I would describe the combat as ranged or nothing, a sword will just kill you off because combat feels like two pufferfush attempting to joust and you just take to much damage to make it viable.4, Updates. Now I'm lazy so I'm just estimating here but I would say it's been more than half a year since any significant update to the game so I wouldn't get hopes up about a patch. (Will remove if updated XD -get on it man!)Conclusion:The game is a Rogue-Like. I love Rogue-Likes so Magicite has a lot going for it in my books. That said, and it pains me to say this.....I can't recomend Magicite. *GASP* it just feels incomplete.I love the concept, Don't like somewhere around 45% of the execution.if you have [ftl,boi,N-throne,Don't Starve] BUY THIS GAME, but otherwise steer clear untill your ready to accept all of it's burdens and glory.

content:
Posted: December 21, 2015
												Great concept, but I would not recommend because of networking issues.  A friend and I started out with no knowledge of the game and died instantly a dozen times in a row, but that's part of the learning.  It was satisfying to progress through and figure out the crafting, and eventually we got to level 11 with some diamondite armor before quitting.But the online play seems to always run into connectivity issues somewhere along the way.  One person would start dropping through the world and not be able to see any other characters, or they couldn't be revived, or items would de-sync and duplicate.  If two players pressed a portal at the same time, we would skip a zone every single time.  We had to agree on who would activate portals to avoid any issues.Since this game has NO saves and makes it very challenging to make any progress at all, the fact that the networking breaks constantly is a huge deal-breaker.  I don't consider it worth playing at all unless they decide to fix those issues.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: May 31, 2016
												This is a good game in and of itself for single player which is fun and great and all. it\'s fun to play for those who like a slider style crafting game with many in-game unlockables like characters, companions, and hats (most of which have in game effects). However, since the developers have abandoned the game multiplayer doesn\'t really work. With my bf whoever hosts, their game works fine and they can play easily. but whoever isn\'t hosting ends up being glitched and stuck either in previous levels/towns unable to continue or move. they slowly catch up but still cannot move or continue. So unless the creators come back and overhall the game or redo their system so that it runs off of steam connection rather than a third party (such as hamachi, evolve or other which eats up ram and causes big latency problems described above) the multiplayer only lasts a few levels before you\'ll have major problems with your other players. thus making the multiplayer useless.Otherwise, Magicite is a fun single player game with many achievement based unlockables of varying difficulties. Naturally most would be easier with a second person to help (such as the no hp potion usage in game). I really like this game and wish the creators would at least come back to FIX the problems such as black screening and multiplayer set to steam connection. people have invested money into this game, which isn\'t really that expensive, and CONTINUE to do so because they like it and want other people to be able to play with them, but soon realize they cannot. its a VERY POSITIVE voted game, when really it should be lower due to the inability of using the multiplayer option that most people aren\'t aware of until after they\'ve purchased the game for themselves, and likely another person.fun game, would be great if it could be multiplayer.4/10 rating honestly because most of the game is fun with other people.. and someone who would APPEAR to take pride in their creation abandoning it is honestly disgusting to me, if you publish something like this, don\'t leave it up for people to waste their time on if you aren\'t going to continue to at least keep it running smoothly, you don\'t need to ADD more, just keep it running just as people keep paying for it. you\'re being paid =/

content:
Posted: February 4, 2016
												I really couldn't decide whether I should recommend it or not. I tried to play it continuously but it's just not possible. Let me tell you the pros and cons that I discoverd so far.PROS: +It has sweet graphics that looks like a cartoon. Even monsters, spiders and other creatures looks so tiny and pretty that you can't take them seriously.+Crafting is nice. You can craft so many things (like hilt) out of wood. You can even craft a Web sword that made out of spider Web (Taken from spiders apparently). Also there are elemental gems that you can craft staff-like items.+Spending time, killing creatures, looting and crafting stuff and achieving some... achievments unlocks some items permanently that give you extra stats. This may be the best idea in the game, I appreciated it.+Movement is cool. Dodging, rolling, jumping... It kinda wants some practice but while moving you feel like 'Vov bit*h catch me if you can'CONS:-It is not a free-world. It's like a dungeon. You have to keep going there is no point of staying in one place. ALSO->>-No building a home or something to let's you stay. That is slightly make you feel bad 'cause you prepare yourself for the monstrosities out there but you don't have any home or place to make you feel safe.-Hunger stat decreases so fast that even though you keep going forward if you don't find a meat or a food suddenly you might find yourself starving. Even if you find a pig or animal to eat (that sounded wierd) it may only drop 1 'food' , so it's not even helping.-Yes, I said that crafting is great, only if you can craft something... While you keep discovering or trying to find the loot that you're looking for a while, you probably die 1636 times. (Only if you don't know, when you die it's 'gameover')RECOMMENDATIONS: >It should be easier to collect stuff, this would help you to craft so the game would be more fun to play.>Map should be branched out to every direction to increase the possibilities and excitement, not only one way.>You could be crafting a chest to store stuff, so this brings the settlement idea. A house...I bought it on discount, it was very cheap according to it's original price. So don't buy it until you catch it in discount. 👍💪

Posted: May 16, 2016
												This is a really fun game. there are lots of places that you can go to meeting new enemies and creatures that get harder and harder as you progress through the game. The final boss is a really fun fight to do as well ramping up the difficulty as much as possible. there are many different items that you can get as well, the crafting system in the game is very simple once you can understand how to do things. I have been playing this game since beta and i still love playing it. The multiplayer in this game is really fun as well, if you want to play from computers that are not on the same wifi i suggest using hamachi so that you are able to, otherwise you wont be able to play multiplayer just yet. All in all this game is amazing to play and i would really suggest people getting it and playing it.

												I buy roguelikes but often don't end up playing them much (since I'm terrible at them).  With this one it's fun and addictive and I keep on going back for more.  Great little game!Gathering and crafting some of your gear is fun, the procedurally generated levels keep things spicy, the large amount of unlocks you can earn, and the different play styles of the classes all make for great replay and push one to succeed.You can finish a play thru in an hour or so which is a nice amount of time and still feel like turning right around and doing it again.

content:
Posted: January 13, 2016
												Easily my best game in the last half year, I've give more hours to this game trying to unlock everything. I picked it up in a sale, however I feel the asking price is more than fair. Each character has a different style of playing, I personaly prefer bow and arrow but you have to work slowly up from sword play etc. Each hat, race, companion you unlock really changes the game, some times making it easier while somtimes making it much harder, if you are into that thing!It has a great crafting mechanic that isn't over whelming, most things make sense that you don't need to look up a wiki to craft everything, however I would still recommend it for impatient gamers.I like the resource collecting though it can be tideous however you can have perks to help you there! A good amount of enemies per stage, I love the bosses but nothing to complicated, I think if I was to change anything I would make the bosses a bit more difficult, the hardest part seems to be removing around the lower enimies while fighting the boss.9 / 10

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 1, 2016
												Magicite is a cute little, fiendish roguelite action platformer with simplistic gameplay and graphics but addictive features that make you want to keep on playing. The game covers inventory, crafting and items very well as it does its platforming. The combat is decent and revolves heavily around timing and stats. It does not take long to get used to the game’s controls and its basic crafting techniques, but when you do it’s a little joy of a game. You could place Magicite under the easy to learn hard to master games but once you’ve got the hang of it and you’ve gotten better it is not that difficult. My least favourite thing about this game is that once you have a good run and gear and then you die you have to start from the beginning again. It kind of makes this easier to take because you can receive different races, hats and companions and cosmetics from achieving certain things in a run. Magicite is not endless and has several bosses, (none of which I have defeated yet) and an ending. All together I Think Magicite is a superb video game and would recommend it to anybody who enjoys roguelites that don’t require an obscene amount of time and can take their characters death. I think it is very underrated and should get more light.7/10Note to Developers: I would love to see steam achievements implemented please!

content:
Posted: June 22, 2015
												This is an OK game if you can get it on sale, but it's important to note that the net code for multiplayer is not perfect. There can be strange bugs for some players where the entire level is black except the character they're playing and the other characters (all enemies are also black). Addtionally, it can be a bit of a tough game to pick up for people who aren't the best at platformers, but that hurdle is quickly overcome after an hour or so of play. All in all though, I do not think this game would have been worth the full $10 price tag.

content:
Posted: July 21, 2016
Product received for free
												Okay, If you love Castlevania, Legend of zelda 2, and megaman, all cramed into one game, you got it. Although this game has one problem, Its as difficult as them all in one, and it is awesome for it, i dont recommend this game if you are a casual gamer, but if you like a good, and i mean insane challenge, then play this game, i binge-play it when im bored, and i turn that boredom into frustration and awesomeness, if you ask me its more difficult than dark souls, and also in my opinion, twice as badass, and dont get me started on multiplayer, its still difficult, but its way more awesome, and it has an extreme replay value cause of the randomized layouts and is an awesome way to spend an hour on this, also, my personal loadout is. Orclops: with the miner cap, the fairy companion, the brewer perk, and the gatherer perk, but its still difficult, i recommend useing a powerfull sword and getting 1 warrior skill and 2 archer skills, But all-in-all Its has the Buttman Seel of aproval, and a solid 9.3/10, why 9.3, cuz a 9 is not high enough. Side note: i was fortunate to recieve this game as a christmas gift and i have to say, i owe him big time for such an awesome game.

												This game can be difficult to start, as it doesn't give you a single recipe for crafting (Well, one...) and throws you straight into a room filled with hostile monsters, except the pigs, the pigs never tried to hurt you, did they? It has a nice sort of 8-bit art style, and the combat is focused on pattern memorization, though when three dragons are flying around it gets a bit crazy. Overall I would rate 9.5/10. Good game.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 9, 2016
												Magicite is a good game, get it on sale or if you're really hyped to play it just but it Pros-Good graphics-good dodging-unique fighting-Great non-laggy multiplayer-Pretty cheap-Lots of hats and races-Great crafting Negatives-Not enough variants/upgrades for mage and archer-Enemy attacks are generally pretty simple-Not enough utility items-No save and continue for later option-Shops can be quite useless because you can only buy things once, i.e potionsThings I would love to see in future updates-more complex towns, different types of towns maybe-more items-more diverse enemies-Possibly another interesting fighting mechanic like blocking-Different types of potions-Different types of bows and staffs (yes i know there is more than 1 staff but i would like upgrades)In total it's a great game as it is and could become even better if updates roll in, I recommend to buy it with atleast 1 other friend when it's on sale and play together using hamachi or port forwarding, I hope the creator sees this review

content:
Posted: December 21, 2016
Product received for free
												For startersI love the concept of this game, it being a terraria,dungeon type game.But... there are alot of problems that need urgent fixing.Me and my friends decided to play multiplayer. so we went ahead and did so.However we couldnt connect. So we had to launch up hamachi in order to do so. And even after we launched up hamachi it still didnt perform well. If you are to disconnect from the server then you cant connect back. Or when you die, there is a chance that you may be stuck in a black screen that is really laggy.You cant enter the settings when in game you have to exit to the menu in order to do so.Not much choice when it comes to making your player.There is no option to turn of the music without having to turn down the whole audio.Overall the devs/dev of this game needs to fix it soon, ive played games like this before just never this buggy.- 4.4/10

content:
Posted: March 6, 2014
												Wow, this game is difficult.Magicite is a 2d roguelike action/survival game. The goal is to get from one end of the level to the other and picking from 3 doors at the end of said level to pick the theme of the next. I've yet to beat the game, so writing a review may be a tad premature, but I actually find this game very fun if needlessly cruel and unforgiving. I do stress that this game is unforgiving though, which most would just describe as difficult. No, this game will beat you down if you make a single mistake.Overall, it's a very fun experience on singleplayer.I'd say something on multiplayer, however none of my friends own this game.To summarize, the game is difficult and unforgiving, but very fun and overlooked.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 22, 2015
												This game is what happens when you combine an RPG, a roguelike and a crafting system. Basically, you'll need to craft some thing with materials you collect from the world around and use them to kill the enemies to get to the end of a randomly generated level. You then move on to the next level and if you die you have to start all over again. It's basic roguelike material but it involves a crafting system and a terraria-like combat system. It makes the game unique, despite it's similarities to terraria and a refreshing experience. Also it has multiplayer.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 1, 2016
												Once upon a time, rocks fell and everyone died, because Voldemort took over the world...sort of.  You see, he didn't take over all of the world, so humanity fled beneath the surface to previously unexplored caves lush with life that requires sunlight to grow, including but not limited to plants, trees, T-Rexes, Shelob, Bilbo, and...wait, we're still talking about Magicite, right?Magicite is a side-scrolling roguelike, where you adventure through areas in pursuit of defeating The Scourge, because Arthas is a wuss...wait, we're still talking about Magicite right?As you can tell, Magicite draws from various RPGs of yesteryear for its inspiration despite being a sidescroller.  Each Death is very important, because you can win new races with different starting loadouts, hats, and companions.But is it good?What WorksThe 2D presentation is amped up by clever use of 3D techniques such as bloom shaders; the UI integrates seamlessly with the rest of the game.  Visually, there are really no faults to speak of in this title.The controls are somewhat intuitive, and pressing Escape brings them up - left clicking 'attacks' with an item, while right click uses an item's special abilities (such as firing an arrow, firing a spell, etc.)  The in-game crafting in particular is well-suited to quickly creating things in order to defeat challenges.The game's tempo is also good; after every area, you find a town, where you can do more in-depth crafting, sell spare items, buy items, and generally take a short breather.  This is good, because each area has a hidden time limit - if you stay too long, the Dungeon Guardian comes and deals you 9999 damage when it hits you...wait, we're still talking about Magicite, right?What Does Not WorkThe first thing I noticed is that the physics are sort of wonky, if things land on top of you - they will sort of sit there and inhibit your ability to jump.  Sometimes it autoresolves, but not always - I've been able to blame a death on this particular physics bug.Next, you can gain special abilities as you play through the game.  The controls for these abilities are obscure.  While you can see them with Escape, I find them forgettable and awkward to use.  I'm sure I would find the game more manageable if the special abilities unlocked by leveling up were more obvious, and easier to use.Another thing at least for me is that after a few minutes of play, the audio for the game will mysteriously cut out for seemingly no reason at all.  This is very bad, because the game has a number of audio cues to telegraph certain things (like Scourge invasions).While this is a Roguelite with all of the difficulty such a title entails, I find the game's difficulty curve a touch too high, actually - after a number of playthroughs, I've not managed to fight the final boss yet, and usually die well beforehand due to healing potions being too hard to come by.  While most 'traps' deal 1 damage, monsters usually deal 2, and strong monsters deal 4 damage per hit, in later screens it's possible to have the game more or less transition into a bullet hell game...which, this game is not tuned for.  I rarely say this due to games these days being too easy, but this one I feel is a touch too hard, but not due to my lack of skill, per se - increase the drop chance for Herbs (used to make Healing Potions), and try to tune the RNG to not spawn a bunch of projectile-spamming enemies.  The fact that I can hit more or less unwinnable screens is a Bad Thing™.Lastly, decrease the dependence on the RNG.  I know, I know - Roguelite.  Much RNG is to be expected, but in this game, there are some really pointless randomizations on things - for instance, tools can grant HP gains, but only while you're using that tool.  If you're switched away from that tool, you can have full HP.  Due to the fact that there are no external healing sources, this means with a HP tool, you can never have full HP.  This isn't game-breaking, but it horribly inflames my OCD!  Stop doing that to me game!  Additionally, why give magic power to mundane tools like swords, axes, and pickaxes?  You can only use magic by using magic staves; if a staff has no Magic modifier, but a tool does, that's pointless!  WTF game!?The TL;DRShould you buy Magicite?  Yes, absolutely recommended, it's a game worth your purchase, but it has problems that make it more frustrating than a Roguelite should be.  Still, these problems are often mild enough that you should still be able to enjoy the game as I am, and feel that you're getting your money's worth.

content:
Posted: January 8, 2015
												I recommend waiting till its on sale.The game is fun,   but it gets disheartening and boring after the 20th plus death and restart.   Pros ~Lots of different characters, accessories, character customizations(different hairstyles) that are unlockable.visually appealing backgrounddifferent Biomes and biome specific mobseasy to use controls.Crafting is pretty simple (once you know how)Cons ~To unlock some characters you need to reach a certain level, gather a certain amount of stuff or kill a number of enemies,  stuff like that,  but then it gives you like a 20% chance of unlocking the character, (for doing what it wants)  so,  you may survive all the way through and reach that point or gather what you needed,  but still not get the character or other unlockable.Feels like the starting health is too low,  since you'll spawn with about 4-9 hp maybe depending on what you picked,  since where you are seems random, you might end up getting screwed by a tough enemy.The game kind of just throws you in,  unless I missed it there was no guide for how to craft anything,  had to go search for the wiki to learn how to make anything.All in all,  its not a bad game,  some things are good,  some things..  are not.     Suggest waiting till its on sale to buy it though.

Product received for free
												Okay, If you love Castlevania, Legend of zelda 2, and megaman, all cramed into one game, you got it. Although this game has one problem, Its as difficult as them all in one, and it is awesome for it, i dont recommend this game if you are a casual gamer, but if you like a good, and i mean insane challenge, then play this game, i binge-play it when im bored, and i turn that boredom into frustration and awesomeness, if you ask me its more difficult than dark souls, and also in my opinion, twice as badass, and dont get me started on multiplayer, its still difficult, but its way more awesome, and it has an extreme replay value cause of the randomized layouts and is an awesome way to spend an hour on this, also, my personal loadout is. Orclops: with the miner cap, the fairy companion, the brewer perk, and the gatherer perk, but its still difficult, i recommend useing a powerfull sword and getting 1 warrior skill and 2 archer skills, But all-in-all Its has the Buttman Seel of aproval, and a solid 9.3/10, why 9.3, cuz a 9 is not high enough. Side note: i was fortunate to recieve this game as a christmas gift and i have to say, i owe him big time for such an awesome game.

												For startersI love the concept of this game, it being a terraria,dungeon type game.But... there are alot of problems that need urgent fixing.Me and my friends decided to play multiplayer. so we went ahead and did so.However we couldnt connect. So we had to launch up hamachi in order to do so. And even after we launched up hamachi it still didnt perform well. If you are to disconnect from the server then you cant connect back. Or when you die, there is a chance that you may be stuck in a black screen that is really laggy.You cant enter the settings when in game you have to exit to the menu in order to do so.Not much choice when it comes to making your player.There is no option to turn of the music without having to turn down the whole audio.Overall the devs/dev of this game needs to fix it soon, ive played games like this before just never this buggy.- 4.4/10

content:
Posted: March 6, 2014
												Wow, this game is difficult.Magicite is a 2d roguelike action/survival game. The goal is to get from one end of the level to the other and picking from 3 doors at the end of said level to pick the theme of the next. I've yet to beat the game, so writing a review may be a tad premature, but I actually find this game very fun if needlessly cruel and unforgiving. I do stress that this game is unforgiving though, which most would just describe as difficult. No, this game will beat you down if you make a single mistake.Overall, it's a very fun experience on singleplayer.I'd say something on multiplayer, however none of my friends own this game.To summarize, the game is difficult and unforgiving, but very fun and overlooked.

												This game is what happens when you combine an RPG, a roguelike and a crafting system. Basically, you'll need to craft some thing with materials you collect from the world around and use them to kill the enemies to get to the end of a randomly generated level. You then move on to the next level and if you die you have to start all over again. It's basic roguelike material but it involves a crafting system and a terraria-like combat system. It makes the game unique, despite it's similarities to terraria and a refreshing experience. Also it has multiplayer.

content:
Posted: January 5, 2016
												I have been playing for 7 hours now and I love the game.  I die a lot, but I love roguelikes so it is awesome.  Very fun and I like the environment.  I am probably going to check out roguelands as well, since it is supposed to be similar.The only thing this game could really use is the ability to save at the town.  I understand that we can't save in the middle of a procedurally generated area, but the towns are relatively safe and the ability to save there, and have the save erased on death would be nice to cut my longer runs into nice smaller increments.Still it's a fun game and I enjoy playing it.

content:
Posted: December 8, 2015
												This game had some serious potential, but the dev ♥♥♥♥ED it up.Really, i was hyped to check everyday if there was a new update, adding ANYTHING.But rarely was there anything adding to the games depth, no game mechanics, few new items, i felt like it wasnt really loved by the devs as it was loved by me. In the end:,Characters made minor differences, skills had a weired system (They were given to you randomly, making you reroll until you get the few good ones, even tho there are only like.... 11 of them) and there are maybe, 6 enemies, with really easy, short movement patters, and some enemies are already just reskins.If you had asked me if i would recommend this game 5 hours in, i would have scremed "YES!" simply because it COULD ahve been good, and updates happened somewhat frequently.But then, about 10 hours in, everything just stopped.This game is dead, probably.Buy it when you see the devs actually working on it again.And the way it is right now, its maybe worth, 2 bucks, not 10.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 29, 2015
												The Dev ditched this game and had a kickstarter for a new game  "Rouguelands",  which is now an Early Access title on Steam. Said he was still going to update this game, but that was over a year ago. Why in the heck would anyone back a new game of his if he didn't finish the last one. You can shoot enemies with a bow from a distance, and they don't even react, they just stand there and die. On the surface the game looks fun, and it was fun, until I found out the dev ditched it to make an almost identical game... and when I found out about the cheesey bow crap. Wish I knew all this before purchasing... I would recommend this game if it was finished, but why it came out of Early Access is beyond me. I bought it under the impression it was a work in progress, and over a year later..STILL NO UPDATES. Dev said this on December 18th, 2014 on  the Magicite subReddit "my time is like 70% roguelands and 30% magicite right now. I still work on things here and there and add new things to magicite when I think of them, next update will have the altars and gods :D" ... Hope he proves me wrong and finishes this, but in this state I can not reccomend.

content:
Posted: June 3, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game started out very promising and I enjoyed it alot I still play it. It was given it too me by a friend and we played together alot. But lately I noticed isues with the game that never bothered me before because it was still in developement. The multiplayer is often broken and it has no steam server support, the game used to be hard but still beatable now it seems impossible to beat it even 30 hp in total which is a lot of hp in this game.(There is no difficulty choice) Often I keep finding game breaking bugs with or without multiplayer and it seems the maker of the game has abandoned the project. So my advice? Stay away from the game until the owner returns and fixes the issues and difficulty.

content:
Posted: May 21, 2014
Early Access Review
								Alright time for an updated first impressions of Magicite. Remember again that this is an early access review and thus I am reviewing the game in its unfinished state. At the same time the game is being sold as an Early Access game and thus it is more then fair to judge whether or not that feature is worth it.The basic concept of the game is that you are an adventurer stuck in a dungeon using nothing but his/her wits, brawn, and later on 3 magical/skillful/strong skills to survive as well as a wide assortment of craftable weapons, potions, and gear. Enemies require skill to deal with and the game rewards patience and isn't afraid to punish you if you decide you are fed up.On the surface this is a very interesting concept for the game and its simplicity is by far its greatest asset, in spite of disliking the game immediately I found that I really couldn't put it down and found myself enjoying it otherwise. This can be rewarded to its harsh environment, heavy skill focused gameplay, and overall simplicity once you get the hang of things.The downside is that the game is almost too simple. Melee weapons come in very short range swords and extremely slow huge axes (ohh the game has a noob trap in the form of Axes not being effective in combat while still taking durability damage). Arrows will run out of ammo fast, and the magic system while strategic is very underwhelming. Which is sort of the keyword, everything in this game is very underwhelming. Attacking gives the same overhead strike (That doesn't actually hit overhead) and enemies can take several strikes to defeat, making many enemies just a slog to defeat. The Skill system is a lottery as you can end up with rather useless skills or life saving ones (the mage in particular has a few that are essentially and a few that are outright useless).The stage layouts are by far the game's weakest area as they are dull and uninspired. They are just endless hallways with platforms, populated with a few traps and enemies. Some areas certainly look interesting, but you will find out at first glance that all the stages are essentially the same, just with a few elements switched around.Crafting is both the game's strong point and weak point. It doesn't leave a good first impression after a while if you chose to go without a guide... and not having some of the essentially recipes can make things difficult or impossible if you don't find them out. Then once you get the hang of it, it starts being fun... but that fun is ultimately capped off.To confound this the optimal playing strategy is to minimise risk and maximise reward, which makes sense. Yet the game doesn't amply reward risk. Add in that the game is really a fight to perserve your resources as much as possible (The game is part survival game), and you start to understand that risks tend to eat more resources then they reward while low risk areas often reward you quite a bit, for example the forest gives out the most healing items.Multiplayer suffers from the fact that playing with other players makes the game harder. This is because enemies get stronger, take more hits, while not giving anymore resources and being more capable of dealing more damage. In fact if you and your partner do not know how to make cooked meat this mode is infact outright impossible. The optimal strategy ends up being having one party member clear up an area ahead because that is ultimately safer, essentially making multiplayer a single player experience. The game certainly has hints that multiplayer could be very fun, but this is an early access review and I cannot review a game on what it could be in the future.In the end I just found myself completely untempted to play the game, and the fun just sort of at a dull level. Sure the game is only 5 bucks, but so are a lot of really fun games.As of the 21st of May 2014... I give this game a 5/10You can get this game, you won't lose anything... but you won't really gain anything either.

content:
Posted: June 20, 2014
												I was really looking forward to this game. A quick look at game previews would have you thinking this is a rogue-like with a deep crafting system like Minecraft.Except the crafting is anything but deep.  For example, after crafting a bow and a net string becomes useless (neither items seem to degrade). This means by about 10 districts in, most crafting items are vendor trash, and all you are really searching for is diamonite.And about the districts. They're repetetive. Like, really repetetive. All the different biomes make very little differnce when you're ploughing through the same old reskinned enemies and boring platforming sections. Sure the later ones are really hard, but thats only because the enemies cheat by travelling in and out of the scenery.I understand that this game was only programmed by one person. But not worth the money IMHO

number of helpful: 6 of 14 people (43%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 25, 2016
												Yes, I have a limited amount of time on this game, and from my limited amount of time, I actually enjoyed it. However, there is one reason why I cannot recommend this game: There is no save feature. I love rogue-likes and permadeath, but not having a save feature does not impact the difficulty of the game, only the functionality. This is especially annoying when it comes to multiplayer. Rarely do I have 1+ hours to sit at my computer playing a game nonstop. For this game, you would be forced to work this out between yourselves, limiting what you could actually accomplish. It doesn't make sense that you wouldn't include such a feature, since the game has prebuilt towns that would make a perfect save point. All-in-all, if you have the time to invest multiple hours in succession, this game seems to be very enjoyable. If you are like me, however, and do not have such freedom with your time, it would be a shame to invest in this game.

content:
Posted: November 30, 2014
												+ Some nice music+ Multiplayer works well~ Decent customization of characters (but only after unlocking things)~ Graphics are a bit too pixelized and stylized for me (personally)~ Too much glowing graphics too~ Combat is ok but hitboxes make it questionable- Lacking very much in content - Repetitive, literally copy-pasted levels- Lot of bugs- A lot of missing sound effects for some reason- Feels unfinished overallI could see myself recommending this game if it had more to it. As it is now, there's not much to do in the game itself. You collect things, you fight things, move to the next instance, rinse repeat. Why is this game recommended to highly, I have no idea.

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 26, 2015
												I don't consider Magicite an approachable game, because of this, I'm sort of on the fence about the whole experience. Floundering and dying horribly appear to be an integral part of the initial experience, though I found myself circumventing a lot of this by just looking up recipies and strategies online. Definitely an addictive game if you can get past its intimidating exterior, Magicite feels more like a mountain that needs to be climbed to be appreciated than it does anything else. By no means is it a game that holds your hand. Fans of platformers and roguelikes alike should consider this game, but be wary: it's not for the easily frustrated or anyone looking for some light fun.

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: May 3, 2016
												Starting with positive, I like the controls they feel tight and responsive so far, I like the artstyle, and in general I actually really like the concept of this, Feels more like an arcade version of terreria.BUT almost instantly, out of principle I have to give it a no just because the crafting is so annoying.I didn't realize it would be so unintuitive.clunkily halving ingrediants then crafting 15 sword hilts or whatever because I don't know how to grab just 1 at a time and couldn't even if I wanted to because the inventory is stupidly small.another game with unnecessary amounts of time researching recipes online as I play.Sure after a week or so I will probably get most of it down but the thing isIt adds NOTHING to the game, it only takes away from it.For a game that feels much like an arcadey platformer pop-in-for-a-half-hour-session type of game, I really don't understand what they were thinking with the crafting. The game is at it's core a a relatively simple action/rpg arcade platformer style level based game.design the game as such IMO, it seems to have some identity issues going on.add up resources like you do the gold,Have some sort of crafting menu that simply shows you what you can craft and what you need. Simply click if you have the ingrediants. wow was that so hard? probably would have saved me 3-4 hours of wiki'ing.and if someone were to argue "well that's the fun, you need to be smart about your space and how to craft stuff"sorry but if "inventory management" is a major part of this game, the devs did it wrong.Magicite.A game that doesn't know what it wants to be.
